page.title: 13School to Community Centre
page.content: Nine years ago when Lydney County Junior and Infant Schools moved to new premises the old building became a Community Centre. Rooms were enlarged by removal of dividing walls and facilities such as a coffee bar added, young people helping with some jobs. The Centre has grown steadily and now hosts a large number of activities and organisations covering all ages. For the very young there is a five day a week playgroup, the more elderly an Over 60 Club. Youth organisations meeting there are Guides, Cubs and a Youth Club. Sporting activities include Judo, Boxing and Weight Lifting. Evening classes cater for typing, sewing and weight watchers. The Youth Training Scheme, Citizens Advice BUreau, a mentally handicapped club and others are all catered for by a warden and part time youth leaders.
